page.caption: General Parameters
page.description: This page contains general parameters for the MySQL server.

checkbox.caption: Disable networking
checkbox.description: Don't allow connections via TCP/IP.

spinedit.caption: TCP Port:
spinedit.description: Port number to use for connections.

checkbox.caption: Enable named pipes
checkbox.description: Allow connections via named pipes (Windows NT+ only). Note: you can specify a pipe name on the advanced network page, if required.

textedit.caption: Base directory:
textedit.description: Path to installation directory. All paths are usually resolved relative to this.

textedit.caption: Data directory:
textedit.description: Path to the database root

textedit.caption: Temp directory:
textedit.description: Path to the temporary directory.

spinedit.caption: Key buffer:
spinedit.description: The size of the buffer used for index blocks. Increase this to get better index handling (for all reads and multiple writes) to as much as you can afford; 64M on a 256M machine that mainly runs MySQL is quite common.

spinedit.caption: Sort buffer size
spinedit.description: Each thread that needs to do a sort allocates a buffer of this size.

dropdownbox.caption: Default table type:
dropdownbox.description: If no specific storage engine/table type is defined in an SQL-Create statement the default type will be used.

dropdownbox.caption: Default storage engine:
dropdownbox.description: If no specific storage engine/table type is defined in an SQL-Create statement the default type will be used.

page.caption: MyISAM Parameters
page.description: Edit MyISAM specific parameters on this page.

checkbox.caption: Use concurrent inserts
checkbox.description: Use concurrent insert with MyISAM.

checkbox.caption: Disable external locking
checkbox.description: Do not use system (external) locking. With locking enabled you can run myisamchk to test (not repair) tables while the MySQL server is running.

checkbox.caption: Use external locking
checkbox.description: Use system (external) locking. With this option enabled you can run myisamchk to test (not repair) tables while the MySQL server is running.

spinedit.caption: Minimum word length:
spinedit.description: The minimum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index. Note: FULLTEXT indexes must be rebuilt after changing this variable.

spinedit.caption: Maximum word length:
spinedit.description: The maximum length of the word to be included in a FULLTEXT index. Note: FULLTEXT indexes must be rebuilt after changing this variable.

spinedit.caption: Query expansion limit:
spinedit.description: Number of best matches to use for query expansion.

textedit.caption: Stopword file:
textedit.description: Use stopwords from this file instead of built-in list.

spinedit.caption: Block size:
spinedit.description: Block size to be used for MyISAM index pages.

spinedit.caption: Extra sort file size:
spinedit.description: Used to help MySQL to decide when to use the slow but safe key cache index create method.

spinedit.caption: Max sort file size:
spinedit.description: Don't use the fast sort index method to created index if the temporary file would get bigger than this.

spinedit.caption: Number of repair threads:
spinedit.description: Number of threads to use when repairing MyISAM tables.The value of 1 disables parallel repair.

spinedit.caption: MyIsam Sort buffer size:
spinedit.description: The buffer that is allocated when sorting the index when doing a REPAIR or when creating indexes with CREATE INDEX or ALTER TABLE.

checkbox.caption: Activate InnoDB
checkbox.description: Enable this option only if you would like to use InnoDB tables.

spinedit.caption: Buffer Pool Size:
spinedit.description: The bigger you set this the less disk I/O is needed to access data in tables. On a dedicated database server you may set this parameter up to 80% of the machine physical memory size. Do not set it too large, though, because competition of the physical memory may cause paging in the operating system.

spinedit.caption: Add. mem Pool Size:
spinedit.description: Size of a memory pool InnoDB uses to store data dictionary information and other internal data structures. A sensible value for this might be 2M, but the more tables you have in your application the more you will need to allocate here. If InnoDB runs out of memory in this pool, it will start to allocate memory from the operating system, and write warning messages to the MySQL error log.

spinedit.caption: AWE mem Pool Size:
spinedit.description: You can allocate the InnoDB buffer pool into the AWE physical memory using this parameter.

textedit.caption: Data File Path:
textedit.description: Paths to individual datafiles and their sizes.

checkbox.caption: One File per Table
checkbox.description: This option makes InnoDB to store each created table into its own .ibd file.

textedit.caption: Data directory:
textedit.description: The common part of the directory path for all InnoDB datafiles. Leave this empty if you want to split the data files onto different drives.

textedit.caption: Log Group Dir:
textedit.description: Directory path to InnoDB log files.

spinedit.caption: Log Files in Group:
spinedit.description: Number of log files in the log group. InnoDB writes to the files in a circular fashion. Value 2 is recommended here. The default is 2.

spinedit.caption: Mirrored Log Groups:
spinedit.description: Number of identical copies of log groups we keep for the database. Currently this should be set to 1.

spinedit.caption: Log File Size:
spinedit.description: Size of each log file in a log group in megabytes. Sensible values range from 1M to 1/n-th of the size of the buffer pool specified below, where n is the number of log files in the group. The larger the value, the less checkpoint flush activity is needed in the buffer pool, saving disk I/O. But larger log files also mean that recovery will be slower in case of a crash. The combined size of log files must be less than 4 GB on 32-bit computers. The default is 5M.

spinedit.caption: Log Buffer Size:
spinedit.description: The size of the buffer which InnoDB uses to write log to the log files on disk. Sensible values range from 1M to 8M. A big log buffer allows large transactions to run without a need to write the log to disk until the transaction commit. Thus, if you have big transactions, making the log buffer big will save disk I/O.

dropdownbox.caption: Flush Log at:
dropdownbox.description: Specifies when log files are flushed to disk.

items.item: Write to Log and flush every second=0
Write Log at commit, flush every second=2

dropdownbox.caption: Flush Method:
dropdownbox.description: Method used for flushing the log files to disk.

dropdownbox.caption: Log archive
dropdownbox.description: This value should currently be disabled.

textedit.caption: Log Archive Dir:
textedit.description: Directory path where log archives should be stored.

spinedit.caption: Lock Wait Timeout:
spinedit.description: Timeout in seconds InnoDB transaction may wait for a lock before being rolled back. InnoDB automatically detects transaction deadlocks in its own lock table and rolls back the transaction. If you use the LOCK TABLES command, or other transaction-safe storage engines than InnoDB in the same transaction, then a deadlock may arise which InnoDB cannot notice. In cases like this the timeout is useful to resolve the situation.

spinedit.caption: Open Files:
spinedit.description: This is relevant only if you use multiple tablespaces in InnoDB. This specifies the maximum how many .ibd files InnoDB can keep open at one time. The minimum value for this is 10. The default is 300.

spinedit.caption: File IO Threads:
spinedit.description: Number of file I/O threads in InnoDB. Normally, this should be 4, but on Windows disk I/O may benefit from a larger number.

spinedit.caption: Thread concurrency
spinedit.description: Helps in performance tuning in heavily concurrent environments.

spinedit.caption: Force recovery
spinedit.description: Helps to save your data in case the disk image of the database becomes corrupt.

checkbox.caption: Fast shutdown
checkbox.description: Speeds up server shutdown process.

spinedit.caption: Max Dirty Pages
spinedit.description: Percentage of dirty pages allowed in bufferpool

page.caption: Performance
page.description: You can configure performance and caching related options here.

spinedit.caption: Query cache limit
spinedit.description: Don't cache results that are bigger than this.

spinedit.caption: Minimal size of result unit
spinedit.description: minimal size of unit in wich space for results is allocated (last unit will be trimed after writing all result data

spinedit.caption: Cache Size
spinedit.description: The memory allocated to store results from old queries.

items.item: Cache all queries except SELECT SQL_NO_CACHE=1

page.caption: Log files
page.description: You can configure all log files options here.

textedit.caption: Binary Logfile Name:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the binary log. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Query Logfile Name:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the query log file. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Error Logfile Name:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the error log file. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Slow Queries Log:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the slow query log. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Update Logfile Name:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the update log file. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Isam Logfile Name:
textedit.description: Enter a name for the isam logfile. Otherwise a default name will be used.

textedit.caption: Log updates for these databases only
textedit.description: Tells the master it should log updates for the specified database, and exclude all others not explicitly mentioned.

textedit.caption: Ignore updates for these databases
textedit.description: Tells the master that updates to the given database should not be logged to the binary log.

textedit.caption: Filename of the index for binary logfiles
textedit.description: File that holds the names for last binary log files.

spinedit.caption: Maximum binary log size
spinedit.description: Binary log will be rotated automatically when the size exceeds this value. Will also apply to relay logs if max_relay_log_size is 0. The minimum value for this variable is 4096.

spinedit.caption: Long query time
spinedit.description: Log all queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute to file.

checkbox.caption: Log only in short format
checkbox.description: Don't log extra information to update and slow-query logs.

checkbox.caption: Log queries that don't use indexes
checkbox.description: Log queries that are executed without benefit of any index.

checkbox.caption: Log warnings
checkbox.description: Log some not critical warnings to the log file.

spinedit.caption: Expire log days
spinedit.description: Logs will be rotated after expire-log-days days

spinedit.caption: Server Id
spinedit.description: Uniquely identifies the server instance in the community of replication partners.

checkbox.caption: Show Slave authentication Info
checkbox.description: If set, allows showing user and password via SHOW SLAVE HOSTS on master.

checkbox.caption: Do not start slave automaticaly
checkbox.description: If set, slave is not autostarted.

checkbox.caption: Use compression
checkbox.description: Use compression on master/slave protocol.

checkbox.caption: Log slave updates
checkbox.description: Tells the slave to log the updates from the slave thread to the binary log. You will need to turn it on if you plan to daisy-chain the slaves.

textedit.caption: Temporary Directory
textedit.description: The location where the slave should put its temporary files when replicating a LOAD DATA INFILE command.

textedit.caption: Skip the following errors:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to continue replication when a query returns an error from the provided list.

textedit.caption: Initial commands
textedit.description: Command(s) that are executed when a slave connects to this master

textedit.caption: Initial replication role
textedit.description: Set the replication role

spinedit.caption: Slave timeout
spinedit.description: Number of seconds to wait for more data from a master/slave connection before aborting the read

textedit.caption: Replicate these databases:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to restrict replication to the specified schemata. Note that this will only work if you do not use cross-database queries such as UPDATE some_db.some_table SET foo='bar' while having selected a different or no database. If you need cross database updates to work, make sure you have 3.23.28 or later, and use replicate-wild-do-table=db_name.%

textedit.caption: Replicate these tables:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to restrict replication to the specified table. To specify more than one table, use the directive multiple times, once for each table. This will work for cross-database updates, in contrast to replicate-do-db.

textedit.caption: Replicate wild these tables:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to restrict replication to the tables that match the specified wildcard pattern. Tospecify more than one table, use the directive multiple times, once for each table. This will work for cross-database updates. Example: replicate-wild-do-table=foo%.bar% will replicate only updates to tables in all databases that start with foo and whose table names start with bar

textedit.caption: Ignore DBs:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to not replicate to the specified database. To specify more than one database to ignore,use the directive multiple times, once for each database. This option will not work if you use cross databaseupdates. If you need cross database updates to work, make sure you have 3.23.28 or later, and use replicate-wild-ignore-table=db_name.%

textedit.caption: Ignore tables:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to not replicate to the specified table. To specify more than one table to ignore, use the directive multiple times, once for each table. This will work for cross-datbase updates, in contrast to replicate-ignore-db.

textedit.caption: Wild ignore tables:
textedit.description: Tells the slave thread to not replicate to the tables that match the given wildcard pattern. To specify more than one table to ignore, use the directive multiple times, once for each table. This will work for cross-database updates. Example: replicate-wild-ignore-table=foo%.bar% will not do updates to tables in databases that start with foo and whose table names start with bar.

textedit.caption: Rewrite DB names:
textedit.description: Updates to a database with a different name than the original. Example:replicate-rewrite-db=master_db_name->slave_db_name.

textedit.caption: Report Host:
textedit.description: Hostname or IP of the slave to be reported to to the master during slave registration. Will appear in the output of SHOW SLAVE HOSTS. Leave unset if you do not want the slave to register itself with the master. Note that it is not sufficient for the master to simply read the IP of the slave off the socket once the slave connects. Due to NAT and other routing issues, that IP may not be valid for connecting to the slave from the master or other hosts.

textedit.caption: Report User:
textedit.description: This username will be displayed in the output of "SHOW SLAVE HOSTS".

textedit.caption: Report Password:
textedit.description: This password will be displayed in the output of "SHOW SLAVE HOSTS".

spinedit.caption: Report Port
spinedit.description: Port for connecting to slave reported to the master during slave registration. Set it only if the slave is listening on a non-default port or if you have a special tunnel from the master or other clients to the slave. If not sure, leave this option unset.

textedit.caption: Relay log filename:
textedit.description: The location and name to use for relay logs.

textedit.caption: Relay log index filename:
textedit.description: The location and name to use for the file that keeps a list of the last relay logs.

textedit.caption: Relay log info filename:
textedit.description: The location and name of the file that remembers where the SQL replication thread is in the relay logs.

checkbox.caption: Purge relay logs
checkbox.description: 0 = do not purge relay logs. 1 = purge them as soon as they are no more needed.

spinedit.caption: Maximum size for all relay logs together:
spinedit.description: Maximum space to use for all relay logs.

spinedit.caption: Maximum relay log size
spinedit.description: If non-zero: relay log will be rotated automatically when the size exceeds this value; if zero (the default): when the size exceeds max_binlog_size. 0 expected, the minimum value for this variable is 4096.

textedit.caption: Master hostname:
textedit.description: Master hostname or IP address for replication. If not set, the slave thread will not be started. Note that the setting of master-host will be ignored if there exists a valid master.info file.

textedit.caption: Master Username:
textedit.description: The username the slave thread will use for authentication when connecting to the master. The user must have FILE privilege. If the master user is not set, user test is assumed. The value in master.info will take precedence if it can be read.

textedit.caption: Master password:
textedit.description: The password the slave thread will authenticate with when connecting to the master. If not set, an empty password is assumed.The value in master.info will take precedence if it can be read.

spinedit.caption: Master port
spinedit.description: The port the master is listening on. If not set, the compiled setting of MYSQL_PORT is assumed. If you have not tinkered with configure options, this should be 3306. The value in master.info will take precedence if it can be read.

spinedit.caption: Master connect retry
spinedit.description: The number of seconds the slave thread will sleep before retrying to connect to the master in case the master goes down or the connection is lost.

textedit.caption: Master retry count
textedit.description: The number of tries the slave will make to connect to the master before giving up.

textedit.caption: Master info file name:
textedit.description: The location and name of the file that remembers the master and where the I/O replication thread is in the master's binlogs.

checkbox.caption: Master ssl
checkbox.description: Enable the slave to connect to the master using SSL.

textedit.caption: Master SSL Key:
textedit.description: Master SSL keyfile name. Only applies if you have enabled master-ssl.

textedit.caption: Master SSL Certificate filename:
textedit.description: Master SSL certificate file name. Only applies if you have enabled master-ssl

textedit.caption: Master SSL CA filename:
textedit.description: Master SSL CA file. Only applies if you have enabled master-ssl.

textedit.caption: Master SSL CA-path:
textedit.description: Master SSL CA path. Only applies if you have enabled master-ssl.

textedit.caption: Master SSL Cipher:
textedit.description: Master SSL cipher. Only applies if you have enabled master-ssl.

textedit.caption: Socket/pipe name:
textedit.description: Name of the socket file (Unix) or named pipe (Windows) to use.

spinedit.caption: Max. packet size:
spinedit.description: Max packetlength to send/receive from to server.

spinedit.caption: Net buffer length
spinedit.description: Buffer length for TCP/IP and socket communication.

spinedit.caption: Connection timeout
spinedit.description: The number of seconds the mysqld server is waiting for a connect packet before responding with 'Bad handshake'

spinedit.caption: Interactive timeout
spinedit.description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.

spinedit.caption: Read timeout
spinedit.description: Number of seconds to wait for more data from a connection before aborting the read

spinedit.caption: Write timeout
spinedit.description: Number of seconds to wait for a block to be written to a connection before aborting the writ

spinedit.caption: Wait timeout
spinedit.description: The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a connection before closing it

spinedit.caption: Max Connections:
spinedit.description: The number of simultaneous clients allowed.

spinedit.caption: Max Conn per User:
spinedit.description: The maximum number of active connections for a single user (0 = no limit).

spinedit.caption: Retry count:
spinedit.description: If a read on a communication port is interrupted, retry this many times before giving up.

spinedit.caption: Max Conn Errors:
spinedit.description: If there is more than this number of interrupted connections from a host this host will be blocked from further connections.

checkbox.caption: Disable caching of host-names
checkbox.description: Don't cache host names.

checkbox.caption: Disable name resolving
checkbox.description: Don't resolve hostnames. All hostnames are IP's or 'localhost'.

page.caption: Security
page.description: This page contains general parameters for the MySQL server.

checkbox.caption: Safe User Create
checkbox.description: Don't allow new user creation by the user who has no write privileges to the mysql.user table.

checkbox.caption: Disable grant tables
checkbox.description: Start without grant tables. This gives all users FULL ACCESS to all tables!

checkbox.caption: Make all tables read-only
checkbox.description: Make all tables read-only, with the exception of replication (slave) threads and users with the SUPER privilege.

checkbox.caption: Deactivate show database
checkbox.description: Don't allow 'SHOW DATABASE' commands

checkbox.caption: Use old passwords
checkbox.description: Use old password encryption method (needed for 4.0 and older clients).

checkbox.caption: Secure authentication
checkbox.description: Disallow authentication for accounts that have old (pre-4.1) passwords.

checkbox.caption: Enable load data local infile
checkbox.description: Enable/disable LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE

page.caption: Advanced
page.description: You will find all advanced settings here.

textedit.caption: Language:
textedit.description: Client error messages in given language. May be given as a full path.

textedit.caption: Def. Char Set:
textedit.description: Set the default character set.

textedit.caption: Default Collation:
textedit.description: Set the default collation.

textedit.caption: Charsets directory:
textedit.description: Path to the character-sets directory.

checkbox.caption: Print stack trace
checkbox.description: Print a symbolic stack trace on failure.

checkbox.caption: Flush tables
checkbox.description: Flush tables to disk between SQL commands.

spinedit.caption: Flush time
spinedit.description: A dedicated thread is created to flush all tables at the given interval.

checkbox.caption: Set up for GDB
checkbox.description: Set up signals usable for debugging

checkbox.caption: Low priority updates
checkbox.description: INSERT/DELETE/UPDATE has lower priority than selects.

checkbox.caption: Memory lock
checkbox.description: Lock mysqld in memory.(=Don't swap.)

checkbox.caption: Old rpl compat
checkbox.description: Use old LOAD DATA format in the binary log (don't save data in file).

checkbox.caption: Disable stack trace
checkbox.description: Don't print a stack trace on failure

textedit.caption: Default week format:
textedit.description: The default week format used by WEEK() functions.

spinedit.caption: Open files limit
spinedit.description: If this is not 0, then mysqld will use this value to reserve file descriptors to use with setrlimit(). If this value is 0 then mysqld will reserve max_connections*5 or max_connections + table_cache*2 (whichever is larger) number of files.

spinedit.caption: Maximum error count
spinedit.description: Max number of errors/warnings to store for a statement.

checkbox.caption: Deactivate thread priority
checkbox.description: Don't give threads different priorities.

spinedit.caption: Thread concurrency
spinedit.description: Permits the application to give the threads system a hint for the desired number of threads that should be run at the same time

spinedit.caption: Thread cache size
spinedit.description: How many threads we should keep in a cache for reuse.

spinedit.caption: Thread stack size
spinedit.description: The stack size for each thread.

spinedit.caption: Slow launch time
spinedit.description: If creating the thread takes longer than this value (in seconds), the Slow_launch_threads counter will be incremented.

spinedit.caption: Insert delayed Timeout
spinedit.description: How long a INSERT DELAYED thread should wait for INSERT statements before terminating.

spinedit.caption: Insert delayed Limit
spinedit.description: After inserting delayed_insert_limit rows, the INSERT DELAYED handler will check if there are any SELECT statements pending. If so, it allows these to execute before continuing.

spinedit.caption: Insert delayed queue size
spinedit.description: What size queue (in rows) should be allocated for handling INSERT DELAYED. If the queue becomes full, any client that does INSERT DELAYED will wait until there is room in the queue again.

spinedit.caption: Maximum Threads
spinedit.description: Don't start more than this number of threads to handle INSERT DELAYED statements. If set to zero, which means INSERT DELAYED is not used.

spinedit.caption: Max join size
spinedit.description: Joins that are probably going to read more than max_join_size records return an error

spinedit.caption: Maximum binlog cache size:
spinedit.description: Can be used to restrict the total size used to cache a multi-transaction query.

spinedit.caption: Query alloc block size:
spinedit.description: Allocation block size for query parsing and execution

spinedit.caption: Query prealloc size
spinedit.description: Persistent buffer for query parsing and execution

spinedit.caption: Read buffer size
spinedit.description: Each thread that does a sequential scan allocates a buffer of this size for each table it scans. If you do many sequential scans, you may want to increase this value.

spinedit.caption: Read rnd buffer size
spinedit.description: When reading rows in sorted order after a sort, the rows are read through this buffer to avoid a disk seeks. If not set, then it's set to the value of record_buffer.

spinedit.caption: Range alloc block size
spinedit.description: Allocation block size for storing ranges during optimization

spinedit.caption: Preload buffer size
spinedit.description: The size of the buffer that is allocated when preloading indexes

spinedit.caption: Table cache:
spinedit.description: The number of open tables for all threads.

spinedit.caption: Temporary table size
spinedit.description: If an in-memory temporary table exceeds this size, MySQL will automatically convert it to an on-disk MyISAM table.

spinedit.caption: Transaction alloc block size
spinedit.description: Allocation block size for transactions to be stored in binary log

spinedit.caption: Transaction prealloc size
spinedit.description: Persistent buffer for transactions to be stored in binary log

textedit.caption: Max write lock count
textedit.description: After this many write locks, allow some read locks to run in between

spinedit.caption: Bulk insert buffer size
spinedit.description: Size of tree cache used in bulk insert optimisation. Note that this is a limit per thread!

spinedit.caption: Max heap table size
spinedit.description: Don't allow creation of heap tables bigger than this.

spinedit.caption: Max length for sort data
spinedit.description: Max number of bytes in sorted records.

textedit.caption: Max seeks for key
textedit.description: Limit assumed max number of seeks when looking up rows based on a key

spinedit.caption: Max sort length
spinedit.description: The number of bytes to use when sorting BLOB or TEXT values (only the first max_sort_length bytes of each value are used; the rest are ignored).

spinedit.caption: Max temporary tables:
spinedit.description: Maximum number of temporary tables a client can keep open at a time.

spinedit.caption: Join buffer size:
spinedit.description: The size of the buffer that is used for full joins.

spinedit.caption: Key cache block size
spinedit.description: The default size of key cache blocks

spinedit.caption: Key cache division limit
spinedit.description: The minimum percentage of warm blocks in key cache

spinedit.caption: Key cache division age treshold
spinedit.description: This characterizes the number of hits a hot block has to be untouched until it is considered aged enough to be downgraded to a warm block. This specifies the percentage ratio of that number of hits to the total number of blocks in key cache

spinedit.caption: Back log size
spinedit.description: The number of outstanding connection requests MySQL can have. This comes into play when the main MySQL thread gets very many connection requests in a very short time.

spinedit.caption: Binlog cache size
spinedit.description: The size of the cache to hold the SQL statements for the binary log during a transaction. If you often use big, multi-statement transactions you can increase this to get more performance.

spinedit.caption: Group concat max len
spinedit.description: The maximum length of the result of function group_concat.

textedit.caption: Delay key write:
textedit.description: Type of DELAY_KEY_WRITE.

dropdownbox.caption: Make table names case insensitive
dropdownbox.description: If set to 0, table and db names are stored with the lettercase specified during creation and comparisons are case sensitive. If set to 1 table names are stored in lowercase on disk and table names will be case-insensitive. If set to 2, names are stored as specified during creation but are compared case-insensitively (Only works on case-insensitive filesystems, starting from MySQL 4.1.8).

checkbox.caption: Enable symbolic link support
checkbox.description: N/A

textedit.caption: Run as User:
textedit.description: Run mysqld daemon as user.

textedit.caption: SQL Mode:
textedit.description: Syntax: sql-mode=option[,option[,option...]] where option can be one of: REAL_AS_FLOAT, PIPES_AS_CONCAT,ANSI_QUOTES, IGNORE_SPACE, ONLY_FULL_GROUP_BY,NO_UNSIGNED_SUBTRACTION.

checkbox.caption: Use pool for temporary files
checkbox.description: Using this option will cause most temporary files created to use a small set of names, rather than a unique name for each new file.

checkbox.caption: Use ANSI SQL
checkbox.description: Use ANSI SQL syntax instead of MySQL syntax.

checkbox.caption: Big Tables
checkbox.description: Allow big result sets by saving all temporary sets on file (Solves most 'table full' errors).

textedit.caption: Bind to IP:
textedit.description: IP address to bind to.

checkbox.caption: Write core file
checkbox.description: Write core on errors.

textedit.caption: Chroot:
textedit.description: Chroot mysqld daemon during startup.

textedit.caption: Init connect:
textedit.description: Command(s) that are executed for each new connection

checkbox.caption: Use new routines
checkbox.description: Use very new possible 'unsafe' functions.

textedit.caption: Pid filename:
textedit.description: Pid file used by safe_mysqld.
